content:
Greetings

Would be needing some help to get zulip under nginx proxy, since the manual install command requires a domain name, and thus the local ips internal ones, are upstreame to nginx proxy that takes them outside to public interfacing. Can someone maybe share his side on this. Thank you.

I had checked that, it does not answer my side where the hostname comes in place
for example server of zulip has ip 172.1.1.1 and hostname zulip.local now that since its not resolving to an external DNS and does not need to in this context. Nginx proxy server has IP 11.11.11.11 lets say and is public, the hostname of zulip points from our DNS to Nginx Proxy, yet we do not run the zulip install from nginx proxy, hope this clears the confusion.

Had a similar installation once You should be able to install you should be able to run the installer with the --self-signed-cert option and the domain that users will use to access Zulip from the internet
